review: It makes easy work of adding the internet and netflix and other apps to non-smart tv's. I have a nice 42" panasonic plasma in my bedroom and its great now that it is "smart" However the user interface is not as nice as a smart tv but like I said it does work and its nice to have the net connected to a non smart tv.Its nice not to have second remote but you do sorta have a second remote because you can only control the programming with your phone but the volume and other tv controls have to be controlled with your tv remote.Easy to hook up and set up and I got it for $23 total and shipped fast. All other devices on the market (Roku, Amazon, Apple, etc) are all $80-$100. So although the Chromecast has a few quirks I dont like (the other brands probably do as well) its an amazing value for what you get and it does what its supposed to in that it makes your non smart tv into a smart tv. I would recommend this to anyone!
